  • Uses of CheckerTree in com.luchersol.core.specialized_checkers.collection

    Subclasses with type arguments of type CheckerTree in com.luchersol.core.specialized_checkers.collection
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    CheckerTree<T>
    A specialized checker for Tree data structures, providing a fluent API to assert various properties and invariants about a tree.
    Methods in com.luchersol.core.specialized_checkers.collection that return CheckerTree
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <T> CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.check(Tree<T> tree)
    Creates a CheckerTree for the given tree with a default name.
    static <T> CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.check(Tree<T> tree, String name)
    Creates a CheckerTree for the given tree and assigns a custom name.
    static <T> CheckerTree<T>

    Creates a CheckerTree from a root value with a default name.

    Creates a CheckerTree from a root value and assigns a custom name.
    static <T> CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.check(T rootValue, Map<T,List<T>> childrenMap)
    Creates a CheckerTree from a root value and a map of children, with a default name.
    static <T> CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.check(T rootValue, Map<T,List<T>> childrenMap, String name)
    Creates a CheckerTree from a root value and a map of children, and assigns a custom name.
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.inRangeDepth(int min, int max)
    Checks if the tree's depth is within the specified range (inclusive).
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.inRangeDiamenter(int min, int max)
    Checks if the tree's diameter is within the specified range (inclusive).
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.inRangeLeaves(int min, int max)
    Checks if the number of leaves in the tree is within the specified range (inclusive).
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.isBinaryTree()
    Checks if the tree is a binary tree (each node has at most two children).
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.isEmpty()
    Checks if the tree is empty.
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.isFull()
    Checks if the tree is full (every node has 0 or 2 children).
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.isSymmetric()
    Checks if the tree is symmetric (mirror image around its center).
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.maxDepth(int max)
    Checks if the tree's depth is at most the specified maximum.
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.maxDiamenter(int max)
    Checks if the tree's diameter is at most the specified maximum.
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.maxLeaves(int max)
    Checks if the number of leaves in the tree is at most the specified maximum.
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.minDepth(int min)
    Checks if the tree's depth is at least the specified minimum.
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.minDiamenter(int min)
    Checks if the tree's diameter is at least the specified minimum.
    CheckerTree<T>
    CheckerTree.minLeaves(int min)
    Checks if the number of leaves in the tree is at least the specified minimum.
